title: Can financial regulation avoid a new systemic crisis?
description: M. Ugeux began his career at the Société Générale de Banque in Brussels. After various appointments, he joined the New York Stock Exhange in 1996, eventually building and managing its International Group. In 2003, he founded Galileo Global Advisors to offer CEOs, boards of directors, and governments independent advice. Today, M. Ugeux is a lecturer in law at Columbia Law School, a director of AXA Tian Ping Property & Casualty and a director of Avant Corporation. During this conference, he addressed a question that’s probably looming in the back of many of our minds: “Can financial regulation prevent a new financial crisis?”
author: Georges Ugeux
